text.瞳の色は、産んでくれた母親譲り: Her eye color came from \nher birth mother.
text.シューズ用にとお小遣いを増やしてくれた: They give her extra money \nfor shoes.
text.試しにパパママ呼びをやめたら泣かれた: She cried when she \nstopped calling her mom \nand dad.
text.真っ赤なスーパーカーは、父のお古: She drives her father's \nsecond-hand red supercar.
text.舞台一家で、両親は全国を飛び回っている:
She comes from a stage 
family, her parents 
travel all over the 
country.
text.家族旅行と言えば温泉で、ある秘湯の常連:
Family vacations mean hot 
springs, and she is a 
regular at one of the 
hidden hot springs.
text.国家レベルの機密事項らしい: They seem to be a \nnational secret.
text.よく父とヤンチャして、母に叱られている:
Her and her dad are very 
mischievous together, 
they get scolded by her 
mom a lot.
text.仕事熱心な母親に憧れと恋しい思いがある: She misses her mother, \nwho's always enthusiastic \nabout her work
text.実家にはウェルカム花火が常備されている: My parents always welcome \nfireworks in the house.
text.日本好きは親の影響。実家には和室もある:
"My parents influenced my 
love for Japan. My 
parents have a 
Japanese-style room in 
their house."
text.姐御肌は母譲りで、こう見えて末っ子: She's the youngest child, \nbut has a mother's touch.
text.マンボという鷹と、姉弟のように育った: She grew up with a hawk \nnamed Mambo, he's like \nher sibling.
text.美しい自分を生み育てた親を尊敬している: She respects her parents \nfor raising her to be \ngorgeous.
text.両親と姉いわく『寡黙なのは、優しい証拠』: Her parents and sister \nalways say "taciturnity \nis a sign of kindness".
text.幼い頃から、帝王学を両親自ら教えていた: Her parents taught \nher Imperialism from \na young age.
text.母の誕生会は、1年かけ緻密に計画している: She spends all year \nmeticulously planning her \nmother's birthday party
text.帰省時は、釣り仲間の祖父と船釣りをする:
When she goes home, she 
goes fishing with her 
grandfather and his 
fishing buddies.
text.弟妹たちといる時は『タマねぇね』になる: When she's with her \nbrothers and sisters, \nshe's called "Tama-nee".
text.奔放で開けっ広げな姉の扱いが親以上に上手:
She's better at taking 
care of her uninhibited 
and open-minded sister 
than her parents are.
text.昔は、母が姉妹でおそろいの髪型にしていた: Her mother and her sister \nused to have matching \nhairstyles.
text.空港は、パイロットの父との遊び場だった: Her father was a pilot, \nso the airport was her \nplayground.
text.家族でコーヒー愛好家のため、豆は直輸入: Her family loves coffee, \nso their beans are \nspecially imported.
text.家電がよく壊れるため一家でアナログ生活中:
Her family is living in 
an old-fashioned home 
because of the frequent 
breakage of household 
appliances.
text.父はとても若々しく、よく兄妹に間違われる: Her father is very young \nand is often mistaken for \nher brother.
text.父は料理の師匠で、母はお菓子作りの先生: Her father is a master \nchef and her mother is a \nbaking teacher.
text.上京後も方言が残る娘に、少し安心している: Reliefed their daughter \nretains her dialect after \ngoing to the city
text.昔は、両親の絵本の読み聞かせで寝ていた: She used to fall asleep \nlistening to her parents \nread picture books.
text.レース界での名声華々しい一家の、異端児:
The unorthodox child 
of a family with a spectacular 
reputation in the racing 
world.
text.誕生日ケーキは毎年2つ用意する: They prepare two birthday \ncakes every year.
text.ダービー観戦は、何よりも大切な家族行事:
Watching the Derby 
together is the most 
important family event 
of all.
text.ケーキ屋さん経営中。名物はバウムクーヘン: They run a cake shop, and \ntheir specialty is \nbaumkuchen.
text.娘ロスの家族が、学園スタッフの求人に応募:
They missed their 
daughter so much that 
they applied to be 
members of Tracen 
Academy's staff.
text.服は可愛くて丈夫なものを選んでくれていた: They always picked out \ncute and durable clothes \nfor her.
text.透き通った肌は母、輝くブロンドは父譲り: Her mother has clear \nskin, and her father is a \nbrilliant blonde.
text.家訓は『褒めて褒めて褒めて、褒めたい！』: Her family's motto is \n"Praise, praise, praise, \nand praise!".
text.実家の託児所は、アットホームさが評判:
Her family's day-care 
center has a reputation 
for making people feel 
at home.
text.髪飾りは、母お手製のアイドル衣装第1号: Her hair ornament is from \nthe first idol costume \nthat her mother made.
text.野菜から食べなさい、が1番怒られた思い出:
Her parents always told 
her to eat her veggies 
first, that always made 
her the most upset.
text.ママ友BNWが結成秒読みとのウワサ: Rumor has it that \nthe moms of BNW are \nfriends now.
text.1番好きな母の料理は、にんじんごはん: Her favorite dish was her \nmother's carrot rice.
text.優秀な姉は、妹の明るさに憧れている:
Like an excellent older 
sister, she admires her 
younger sister's 
cheerfulness.
text.帰省すると実家の定食屋に横断幕がかかる: Whenever she goes home, \nher parents hang a banner \nat their restaurant.
